demos.name: Hytool
demos.description: Hytool provides an open environement for the interpretation of well test in matlab. The toolbox contains the most usual analytical solutions used to describe groundwater around wells, as well as functions for importing, displaying the data, and then fitting a model to the data.

demoitem.label: Interpreting data with the Thiem solution
Interpreting data with the Theis (1935) solution
Interpreting data with the Theis (1941) solution with constant head boundary
Interpreting data with the Theis (1941) solution with no-flow boundary
Interpreting data in the aquifer during a test in a large diameter well using the Papadopulos-Cooper (1967) solution and using a single storativity value.
Interpreting data in the aquifer during a test in a large diameter well using the Papadopulos-Cooper (1967) solution and using two single storativity values.
Interpreting data in the aquifer during a test in a large diameter well with skin effect using the Agarwal (1970) solution.
Leaky aquifer with the Hantush (1957) solution
Unconfined delay yield aquifer with Boulton (1963)
Single vertical fracture of infinite conductivity (Gringarten, 1974)
Double porosity fractured aquifer (Warren and Root, 1965)
General Radial Flow model (Barker, 1988)
Fractal model (Delay, 2004)
Large diameter well - Papadopulos-Cooper (1967) solution
Step-drawdown test - Eden-Hazel (1973) solution
Interpreting a variable rate test with the Theis (1935) solution
Interpreting a variable rate test with the Theis (1941) solution with a constant head boundary
Interpreting a variable rate test by deconvoluting the data with Birsoy and Summers (1980) solution
Interpreting a recovery test using the Agarwal (1980 time.
Interpreting a slug test with the Cooper et al (1967) solution
Interpreting a pulse test with the Neuzil (1981) solution
Interpreting a constant head test with Jacob and Lohman (1952) solution
